title: Ticket #3380: Foolproof mechanism for JobRouter routes
description:
Right now, the HTCondor-CE job routes are defined in the configuration file using a simple, declarative language. This allows us to evaluate, set, and delete attributes from the source ad when creating the destination ad.

There are a few problems:

  • Some things are impossible to do in this framework. For example, OSG puts all its environment variables in an external file; this file is read by Globus and the proper variables are inserted into the ClassAd. It's not possible to do this in a JobRoute - you can't do IO or loops with classads.
    • Hence, we need to make the job router hooks plausible for a normal sysadmin to use.
  • There is no mechanism to test or validate job routes.
    • Everyone, including me, who has worked with HTCondor-CE has lost a few hours of time due to a misplaced ";" or using "#" as a comment character in the new-classad.
  • Job hooks exist for the transform, but it's nearly impossible to write them well. Most admins will be tempted to write a shell script. ClassAd parsing rules are pretty complex, especially when it comes to quoting. I suspect writing a compliant classad parser is well outside a normal admin's skillset.

To fix this, I propose two improvements:

  • Building a python wrapper library for libclassad. This will allow admins to safely parse and manipulate ClassAds in a job hook.
  • Build a job route tester and validator. It should, given the on-disk configuration
    • Validate the job routes can be parsed
    • Given a job classad, show which routes would match. Does not need to analyze why routes do not match; we don't need a "condor_router_q -analyze" at this point.
    • Given a job classad and a router, print the resulting classad.

For the callout mechanism, see the following project:

https://github.com/bbockelm/python-classad

2013-Jan-04 18:47:02 by bbockelm:
Here's an example job hook, written using the classad bindings. 

#!/usr/bin/python

import sys
import classad

route_ad = classad.ClassAd(sys.stdin.readline())
separator_line = sys.stdin.readline()
assert separator_line == "------\n"
ad = classad.parseOld(sys.stdin)

ad["Universe"] = 5
ad["GridResource"] = "condor localhost localhost"
if "x509UserProxyFirstFQAN" in ad and "/cms" in ad.eval("x509UserProxyFirstFQAN"):
    ad["AccountingGroup"] = "cms.%s" % ad.eval("Owner")
else:
    ad["AccountingGroup"] = "other.%s" % ad.eval("Owner")

print ad.printOld(),
